slip.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to slide a short distance accidentally, and fall or lose your balance slightly
slip.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Wright slipped but managed to keep hold of the ball.
slip.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to go somewhere, without attracting other people’s attention
slip.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Ben slipped quietly out of the room.
One man managed to slip from the club as police arrived.
slip.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to put something somewhere quietly or smoothly
slip.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Ann slipped the book into her bag.
A letter had been slipped under his door.
Carrie slipped her arm through her brother’s.
slip.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: to give someone something secretly or without attracting much attention
slip.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: I slipped him a ten-dollar bill to keep quiet.
Carr slips the ball to King who scores easily.
slip.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: to move smoothly, especially off or from something
slip.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: As he bent over, the towel round his waist slipped.
Cally slipped from his grasp and fled.
He watched the sun slip down behind the mountains.
The ring had slipped off Julia’s finger.
slip.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: if a knife or other tool slips, it moves so that it accidentally cuts the wrong thing
slip.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: The knife slipped and cut his finger.
slip.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: to become worse or lower than before
slip.translation[0].definitions[6].examp: Standards have slipped in many parts of the industry.
His popularity slipped further after a series of scandals.
You’re slipping, Doyle! You need a holiday.
slip.translation[0].definitions[7].defin: to gradually start being in a particular condition
slip.translation[0].definitions[7].examp: The project has slipped behind schedule.
He had begun to slip into debt.
She slipped into unconsciousness and died the next day.
slip.translation[0].definitions[8].defin: to put a piece of clothing on your body, or take it off your body, quickly and smoothly
slip.translation[0].definitions[8].examp: Peter was already at the door slipping on his shoes.
She slipped out of her clothes and stepped into the shower.
slip.translation[0].definitions[9].defin: if time slips away, past etc, it passes quickly
slip.translation[0].definitions[9].examp: The search for the missing child continued, but time was slipping away.
The hours slipped past almost unnoticed.
slip.translation[0].definitions[10].defi: to get free from something that was holding you
slip.translation[0].definitions[10].exam: The dog slipped his collar and ran away.
slip.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a small or narrow piece of paper
slip.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Molly knew she could not afford to make a single slip.
slip.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: a piece of underwear, similar to a thin dress or skirt, that a woman wears under a dress or skirt
slip.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: an occasion when something becomes worse or lower
slip.translation[1].definitions[4].defin: an act of sliding a short distance or of falling by sliding
slip.translation[1].definitions[5].defin: a part of the field where players stand, trying to catch the ball in cricket
slip.translation[1].definitions[6].defin: a mixture of clay and water that is used for decorating pots
slip.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: to become worse or less or fall to a lower amount, standard etc than before
slip.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: There are fears that consumer confidence may be slipping.
Earnings per share slipped 2% to 9.9 pence.
slip.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: an occasion when something becomes worse or becomes less or lower
slip.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: The slip in demand is seen in other markets besides the U.S.
slip.translation[3].definitions[1].defin: a small narrow piece of paper
slip.translation[3].definitions[1].examp: Always keep your credit card slips.
Have you received a confirmation slip?
